questions.text: Where did Sam first suggest he and Diane go?
questions.explanation:
the couch.

	In Sam's office was a couch that folded out into a bed. Sam, always with a high libido, could't wait to jump into bed (or should I say couch) with Diane.

questions.text: Why didn't Diane want to go to Sam's apartment?
questions.correct: He's taken a lot of women there.
options: It had a really bad odor in it.
questions.explanation:
He's taken a lot of women there.

	Sam wanted to go somewhere special where he'd never been with another woman. Sam had trouble thinking of such a place.

questions.text: How many women did Sam say he'd been with when they were in the office?
questions.explanation:
4.

	Sam had been with 400 women but he gets as far as "4 hun" when Diane gasped. So instead of saying 400 he said "4 hunnies".

questions.text: Where had Sam never been with another woman?
questions.explanation:
Diane's apartment.

	They finally agreed to go to Diane's apartment since Sam had never been there much less with another woman. When he went to the apartment he was surprised by all her stuffed animals.

questions.text: How did Sam respond when Diane said, "It's so filthy."?
questions.correct: "It doesn't have to be, not if we care about each other."
options: "It may be filthy but you're beautiful."
questions.explanation:
"It doesn't have to be, not if we care about each other."

	Sam thought Diane was talking about having sex. Diane was actually talking about her apartment being filthy.

questions.text: What did Carla say Sam and Diane had in common?
options: They were both older than her.
questions.explanation:
They were both born brunettes.

	Carla often made jokes that Diane was not a real blonde. One of her nicknames for Diane was bleach bag.

questions.text: What was the name of Diane's stuffed giraffe?
questions.explanation:
Mr. Jamers

	Diane also had a stuffed bee named Mr. Buzzer. She had a lot of stuffed animals all with names. Sam thought it was weird.

questions.text: When Sam told Diane, "It was 400 women, easy.", how did Diane respond?
questions.explanation:
"They'd have to be."

	This line about 400 women was in reference to earlier in the show when he said "4 hunnies." Diane, while very attracted to Sam, also found Sam to not be very bright.

questions.text: How did Carla tell Sam to get Diane back?
questions.explanation:
use power and control.

	Carla surprisingly gave Sam advice on getting Diane back even though she hated that he was dating her. It wasn't very good advice as Diane only liked "the lift part" of the whole thing.

questions.text: Did Diane call the cops on Sam?
questions.explanation:
No.

	She told Sam that she called the cops but it turned out she didn't. When Sam found this out he started to toss all her stuffed animals out the window.
